title: JPMorgan Chase and Other Big Bank Stocks Gain as Investors Flock Back to the Sector
text:
Bank stocks are enjoying a strong day after JPMorgan Chase and three other big banks—Citigroup, Wells Fargo, and Goldman Sachs Group—reported a mixed bag of third-quarter earnings as investors gravitated to an out-of-favor sector of the stock market.

JPMorgan (ticker: JPM) lived up to its status as the industry leader by generating $2.68 a share in third-quarter profits, up 15% from the year-earlier period and above the consensus estimate of $2.45. Wells Fargo (WFC) and Goldman Sachs (GS) missed estimates, and Citigroup’s...
description: JPMorgan hit a record high after generating $2.68 a share in third-quarter profits, up 15% from the year-earlier period and above the consensus estimate of $2.45.
